item.title: Prince Philip: Gun salutes planned across UK after Duke of Edinburgh dies aged 99
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh, Queen Elizabeth II's husband of 73 years, died on Friday at the age of 99.

item.title: Prince Philip tributes: Royals reflect on the ‘rock in the Queen’s life’
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh's children share reflections on his legacy and "astonishing achievement".

item.title: Prince Philip: Every living US president pays respects
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh saw 18 presidents elected in his lifetime and met many of them with the Queen.

item.title: Prince Philip: What are the plans for his funeral?
item.description: What happens next in the days leading up to the ceremonial funeral of the Duke of Edinburgh?

item.title: Prince Philip: Family visits Buckingham Palace at 1am to lay flowers
item.description: Alex and his two children came to lay flowers at 01:00 BST in memory of the Duke of Edinburgh.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO chief criticises 'shocking' global vaccine divide
item.description: Supply deals between wealthy nations risk worsening vaccine inequality, the health body says.

item.title: NI riots: Police appeal for calm during more disorder in Belfast
item.description: Petrol bombs and bricks have been thrown at police during another night of violence in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Greensill row: David Cameron 'believes he should have sent letter' to Rishi Sunak, says friend
item.description: The former PM now thinks he should have written to the Treasury over Greensill Capital, says a friend.

item.title: Race report: Boris Johnson urged to withdraw 'whitewashing' inquiry
item.description: An open letter signed by 20,000 says a report into racial inequality "provoked national indignation".

item.title: Saint Vincent volcano: 'Explosive' Soufrière eruption sparks mass evacuation
item.description: La Soufrière on Saint Vincent island spews ash 6 km into the air, as 16,000 people are evacuated.

item.title: Covid-19: Ireland adds 16 countries to hotel quarantine list
item.description: Travellers from the US, Canada and France are among those who will be required to stay in hotels.

item.title: DMX, American rapper and actor, dies aged 50
item.description: The US performer, whose real name was Earl Simmons, suffered a heart attack earlier this month.

item.title: Derek Chauvin trial: Police restraint killed George Floyd, expert says
item.description: A forensic pathologist testifies that Mr Floyd's heart and lungs stopped because of a lack of oxygen.

item.title: Nikolai Glushkov: Putin critic 'strangled in London home by third party'
item.description: Former Aeroflot director and Russian exile Nikolai Glushkov was unlawfully killed, a coroner rules.

item.title: The Queen and Prince Philip: An enduring royal romance
item.description: During their 73-year marriage, he was the Queen's public support and the person who knew her best.

item.title: Prince Philip: Matt Smith and Tobias Menzies on playing the duke in The Crown
item.description: What was it like to take on the part of the Duke of Edinburgh in the award-winning Netflix series?

item.title: Prince Philip: The Duke of Edinburgh's Award 'saved me from jail'
item.description: For pals James and Nathan, the awards are about more than hauling badly-packed rucksacks up hills.

item.title: Prince Philip: Death of the Duke of Edinburgh announced
item.description: Crowds gathered outside Buckingham Palace and Windsor Castle and people laid floral tributes.

item.title: Philip tributes: 'A rock, a hero and one of a kind'
item.description: Members of the public gather at Buckingham Palace to lay flowers and show support for the Queen.

item.title: Obituary: HRH The Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh
item.description: Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, won widespread respect for his steadfast and constant support of the Queen.

item.title: Prince Philip: 99 years, 143 countries and one very famous wife
item.description: He was the man beside Queen Elizabeth II - and arguably the world's most famous husband.

item.title: The announcement of the death of Prince Philip
item.description: The BBC's announcement as Buckingham Palace confirms the death of Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh.

item.title: The Papers: Tributes to 'beloved' duke after a 'life of duty'
item.description: The death of the Duke of Edinburgh at the age of 99 dominates all of Saturday's papers.

item.title: Week in pictures: 3 - 9 April 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: LS Lowry Beach Scene bought for £162,500 for Berwick-upon-Tweed
item.description: The "matchstick figures" artist, better known for his industrial scenes, used to holiday in Berwick.

item.title: Sofagate: Turkey and the story of three presidents and only two chairs
item.description: When European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen was left standing because of a lack of chairs in Turkey this week, she reacted with an audible "erm".

item.title: La Soufrière: Thousands flee Caribbean volcano
item.description: La Soufrière on St Vincent island spews ash 6km into the air as thousands are evacuated.

item.title: Greta Thunberg not planning on attending COP26 in Glasgow
item.description: She told the BBC she was concerned about the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on attendance at COP26.

item.title: Why the Chauvin trial ‘exhausts’ black America
item.description: Many say watching George Floyd's final moments is traumatising - and so is the fight for racial justice.

item.title: Save our wine! Big freeze spells disaster for French vineyards
item.description: Vineyards in some areas are reporting extensive damage and the government is declaring a disaster.

item.title: Prince Philip: An extraordinary man who led an extraordinary life
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh's life was filled with contradictions but will be remembered most for his unstinting support of the Queen.

item.title: 'I went from spreadsheets to proning Covid patients'
item.description: Thousands of NHS staff, from dentists to physiotherapists, have been redeployed during the pandemic.

item.title: Vernon Kay on Game of Talents and why 'autocue ruined T4'
item.description: The TV presenter discusses his new ITV game show and why he really, really hates autocue.

item.title: Myanmar citizens flee to India to escape violence
item.description: India is the closest refuge for Myanmar nationals fleeing violence following February's military coup.

item.title: 'Lockdown taught us we're more than just a gym'
item.description: On Monday, businesses will reopen after months of being closed, but can they adapt to the "new normal"?

item.title: Wedding venues: 'It's costing me £250,000 a month'
item.description: Wedding industry professionals rue their loss of income as the economy slowly reopens after lockdown.

item.title: South African artists struggle with Covid theatre closures
item.description: The permanent closure of a top venue symbolises the struggle many performers are facing.

item.title: From 'Porky' to goalie: Peru's presidential candidates
item.description: Eighteen presidential candidates are trying to convince Peruvians tired of politics to vote for them.

item.title: Prince Philip: Sporting world pays tribute to Duke of Edinburgh
item.description: A two-minute silence is held at Aintree as the sporting world pays tribute to Prince Philip, who has died aged 99.

item.title: Sporting memories of Prince Philip
item.description: BBC Sport takes a photographic look at Prince Philip's life in sport.

item.title: Masters 2021: Justin Rose leads at Augusta National, Rory McIlroy and Dustin Johnson miss cut
item.description: Justin Rose holds the lead heading into round three at the Masters but defending champion Dustin Johnson and Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy miss the cut.

item.title: France 3-1 England: Lionesses beaten in friendly
item.description: Fran Kirby's penalty is not enough as England are beaten 3-1 by France in an entertaining friendly international.

item.title: Fulham 0-1 Wolves: Adama Traore with stoppage-time winner for visitors
item.description: Adama Traore strikes an injury-time winner for Wolves as Fulham's hopes of remaining in the Premier League suffer another significant blow.

item.title: Euro 2022: Rachel Furness and Simone Magill give NI victory over Ukraine in play-off first leg
item.description: Northern Ireland score two away goals to beat favourites Ukraine 2-1 in the first leg of the Euro 2022 play-off.

item.title: Will history be made at Grand National as three jockeys vie to become first female winner?
item.description: Three women will bid to become the first female jockey to win the Grand National at Aintree on Saturday.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday abroad or in the UK?
item.description: Anyone in England who travels abroad without good reason will soon face a £5000 fine.

item.title: England lockdown: Countdown to freedom
item.description: As coronavirus restrictions are lifted - when can you return to your favourite activities?

item.title: Covid: How are European countries tackling the pandemic?
item.description: Are European countries relaxing restrictions put in place to control a new wave of infections?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as almost 32 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Under-30s will be not be offered the AstraZeneca vaccine, after concerns over rare blood clots.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Rare blood clots - what you need to know
item.description: We take a look at why these unusual clots happen and when they occur.

item.title: How many people can I have a drink with? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about England's roadmap out of lockdown, and other Covid-related issues.

item.title: Covid: How to get a test for coronavirus
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for, and how do they work?

item.title: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The rules on how many people can meet outdoors are changing, as lockdown is eased.

item.title: Covid: How does the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine work?
item.description: People under 30 are being offered an alternative to the AstraZeneca vaccine after a review into rare blood clots.

item.title: AstraZeneca vaccine: How do you weigh up the risks and benefits?
item.description: A guide to the risks and benefits of receiving the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine.

item.title: What are the UK plans for Covid passports?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Covid: What is the rule of six and what are the social distancing rules?
item.description: Lockdown rules are being eased further in England and Wales so more people can meet up outside.

item.title: Covid: Can my boss force me to go to work?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about going to work?

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will pools, gyms and hairdressers open?
item.description: Lockdown has been eased further - but what does it mean for hairdressers, pubs and gyms?

item.title: Covid: When can restaurants and pubs reopen and what are the rules?
item.description: Hospitality venues are set to gradually open up as lockdown eases across the UK.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for places of worship?
item.description: Places of worship are open across much of the UK, despite lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: Your tributes to those who have died
item.description: A collection of your tributes to some of the thousands of people in the UK who have died with coronavirus.

item.title: Why is the EU unhappy with AstraZeneca?
item.description: The EU has called on AstraZeneca to "catch up" on its deliveries to the EU.

item.title: What are the rules for weddings and when can I hold a reception?
item.description: Wedding ceremonies are still restricted across the UK, but the rules are easing.

item.title: Covid: What’s the problem with the EU vaccine rollout?
item.description: The coronavirus vaccine is being rolled out across the EU but there have been delays.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: As the UK cautiously unlocks, experts will review the evidence on when and where masks are needed.

item.title: Covid: What's happened to crime during the pandemic?
item.description: From dog theft to drug crime, lockdown has led to some big changes in policing.

item.title: Unemployment rate: How many people are out of work?
item.description: The unemployment rate is rising as Covid hits different parts of the economy.

item.title: Covid: The inside story of the government's battle against the virus
item.description: Twenty of Downing Street's most senior politicians, officials and former officials take you "into the room" where essential Covid decisions were being made.

item.title: Covid: The countries that nailed it, and what we can learn from them
item.description: A year into the pandemic, we look at countries that have had some success in tackling the virus.

item.title: Horsey seal with plastic ring on neck for years is rescued
item.description: "Mrs Vicar" is being cared for at an RSPCA centre after having the plastic ring removed by vets.

item.title: Netflix series prompts fan to restore first paid footballer's grave
item.description: Jacqueline McAleese was moved by Fergus Suter's story on Netflix series, The English Game.

item.title: Betfred: Blackjack player wins £1.7m jackpot after High Court battle
item.description: A High Court judge rules the gambling firm was wrong not to pay Andy Green his winnings.

item.title: Latest Trends: A1 x J1 on how Houseparty changed their lives
item.description: Fame, number two in the charts and a remix with Aitch. It's been a life-changing year for A1 x J1.

item.title: Bronze Age slab found in France is oldest 3D map in Europe
item.description: The Bronze Age engravings are a map of part of Brittany, north-west France, researchers believe.

item.title: Race report: Was controversy part of the plan?
item.description: How the government handled the release of a contentious report on racial disparity in the UK.

item.title: 'We found a baby on the subway - now he's our son'
item.description: Danny Stewart saw something on the floor of an NY subway station - soon he would treasure it more than anything.

item.title: Letterbox contact: ‘Don’t my birth children have a right to know I’m dying?'
item.description: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Hanna wanted to tell the twins taken from her at 16 - but had no way of reaching them.

item.title: The cost of speaking up against China
item.description: Uyghurs abroad describe a pattern of harassment and intimidation they say is designed to silence them.

item.title: The vaccine misinformation battle raging in France
item.description: Online conspiracy theories are exacerbating existing vaccine scepticism.
